VII.iii.1.B.7.a
.
Effective Date for Removing a Dependent-Apportionee From a Beneficiary’s Award
In most situations, VA uses the “end-of-month rule” described in
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, 1.C.4.b and c
when removing an apportionee from a primary beneficiary’s award because the apportionee lost status as a dependent.
References
:  For more information on adjusting a primary beneficiary’s award because
the primary beneficiary and spouse-apportionee divorced or annulled their marriage, see
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart iii, 1.B.2
a spouse-apportionee dies, see
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart iii, 1.B.3
, and
a child-apportionee dies, marries, or stops attending school, see
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart iii, 1.B.7.b
.
title: M21-1, Part VII, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section B - Adjusting Apportioned Awards
citation: Part VII, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section B
